thread.title: Benny Scoca catches a record four sailfish to win kayak tournament - Sun Sentinel
thread.title_full: Benny Scoca catches a record four sailfish to win kayak tournament - Sun Sentinel

author: Steve Waters
title: Benny Scoca catches a record four sailfish to win kayak tournament - Sun Sentinel
text:
Benny Scoca catches a record four sailfish to win kayak tournament Joe Hector / Courtesy Benny Scoca of Sunrise with the third of the four sailfish that he caught Saturday and Sunday to win the Extreme Kayak Fishing Sailfish Smack Down tournament out of Pompano Beach. Benny Scoca of Sunrise with the third of the four sailfish that he caught Saturday and Sunday to win the Extreme Kayak Fishing Sailfish Smack Down tournament out of Pompano Beach. (Joe Hector / Courtesy) Caption Scouting for wild turkeys 
Before hunting wild turkeys, it's important to spend some time scouting. 
Before hunting wild turkeys, it's important to spend some time scouting. Caption Scouting for wild turkeys 
Before hunting wild turkeys, it's important to spend some time scouting. 
Before hunting wild turkeys, it's important to spend some time scouting. Caption Cold front bass fishing 
FLW Tour bass pro Mike Surman of Boca Raton said there are two ways to catch bass when a cold front hits South Florida. 
FLW Tour bass pro Mike Surman of Boca Raton said there are two ways to catch bass when a cold front hits South Florida. Caption Steve Waters recaps a down South Florida duck season 
The 2016-17 duck season has been a poor one for South Florida hunters. 
The 2016-17 duck season has been a poor one for South Florida hunters. Caption Channing Crowder fishing 
Former Dolphins linebacker Channing Crowder loves to fish and he loves to help kids, which is why he has Channing Crowder’s Bass Fishing Tournament to raise money for the Boys & Girls Clubs of Broward County. 
Former Dolphins linebacker Channing Crowder loves to fish and he loves to help kids, which is why he has Channing Crowder’s Bass Fishing Tournament to raise money for the Boys & Girls Clubs of Broward County. Caption Wildlife photographer Scott E. Martin 
Wildlife photographer Scott E. Martin loves to shoot photos in the Everglades
